items.name: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the backbone of web pages. It's the markup language used to structure content on the web. The <html> tag is the foundation of every HTML document. Let's explore it!
Basic Structure
items.description:
<html>: The opening and closing tags define the beginning and end of an HTML document.

<head>: Contains metadata like the document's title and links to stylesheets and scripts.

<body>: Houses the visible content of your web page, such as text, images, and links.

items.name: Closing Tag
items.description:
Always close your tags. Forgetting to close a tag can lead to unexpected results.

HTML is versatile, allowing you to add images, links, forms, and more.

This is just the beginning of your HTML journey!
